text: The F-8 Crusader was an American fighter plane made by Vought. It first flew in 1955, and went into the Navy and Marine corps in 1957. It was the only fighter plane in the Vietnam War to have both guns and missiles on it. It was slowly replaced by the F-4 Phantom II and was retired in 1999. There was also a different type of it called the RF-8 Crusader, meant for spying. It also took the pictures of Soviet missiles during the Cuban Missile Crisis. ==Related pages== * A-7 Corsair II Category:United States Navy aircraft Category:United States Marine Corps aircraft Category:French military aircraft Category:Vietnam War aircraft
title: Vought F-8 Crusader
